Reviews.Title: “Great quarters in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LCos54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I cannot say enough about how wonderful our stay was at the Relais St. Honore. The entire staff, especially Jean-Charles, Marie and Jerome at reception, were extremely friendly, professional and helpful. We were very happy with their restaurant recommendations. We stayed in the Junior Suite which had the added benefit of a half bath and day bed in the loft. The rooms were nicely decorated, well kept and cozy. Other family members stayed in several other rooms and all were quite happy with the accommodations. Continental breakfast (13 euros) was excellent. (Note: one serving is more than enough for two people). This hotel is perfectly situated in the 1er Arrondissement. Rue St. Honore is fashionista central. The Louvre, Tuileries, Place Vendome, Harry's New York Bar, Palais Royal are all a block or two away. We could not have been more satisfied and would recommend this hotel to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B in a the best location.”
Reviews.Author: SEB5
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights in this lovely hotel, and were extremely impressed. On arrival we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a larger suite, the location of the hotel in the 1st Arrondissement, so close to the major attractions was perfect for our stay.The hotel is small and the staff very friendly and helpful.The continental breakfast served in your room was also excellent. The B&B thoroughly deserves it's rating. We will definitely stay there next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We are definitely staying here again”
Reviews.Author: katten41
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Regina but it has gotten very pricey. A few blocks away is this perfectly lovely hotel which is much more intimate and friendly. Jerome and Jean-Charles at the front desk are both helpful and extremely pleasant. They booked our restaurant reservations and assisted in a number of other ways. We adored our room, which was spacious and charming, and we always felt happy returning to this quaint, personable oasis during our three day stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, great for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: merosa
Reviews.Content: Great location, near Opera, Tuilleries, the Louvre, Orsay, Grands Boulevards... and that means suitable for walking Paris with children. We stayed in the suite 502, very cosy and well maintained, lovely space suitable for 2 adults and 2 kids. Reasonable prices for its characteristics. Do not try breakfast (you should take it in the room and it is not anything special), there are better places at walking distance (including Angelina).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location & staff”
Reviews.Author: Ted1K
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent: can walk to so many top spots; two metro stops close by; and an upscale neighborhood. The staff is truly interested in making your stay a success. All three Concierges are knowledgable, gracious, and friendly. My 40 year old daughter and her 14 years son were there for five of my seven days. Became like our home. IF trying to locate on a map, hotel is a very short block west of the church Saint-Roche, on the NW corner of rue de la Sourdiere..

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Charm”
Reviews.Author: susan900
Reviews.Content: Our second visit and we would come back again. The hotel is small and charming, the staff helpful and friendly and the location is perfect. Bedrooms and bathrooms are clean, spacious and well appointed with good storage. Plenty of eating options are close by - Pains et Plaisirs for morning coffee with the Parisians, deli-cafes for lunch, and restaurants for dinner in rue Marche St Honore 200m along the street. An 8 a huit market is ooposite. Shopping in this area is fantastic. Lots of sightseeing and galleries within walking distance and two metros close by. The hotel staff are easy to communicate with by email for booking and information.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel. Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Jo C
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delightful hotel and we most definitely would stay here again. Very reasonably priced for Paris and for it's fantastic location, 5 mins walk from the Louvre, the Tuilleries gardens and two metro stations minutes walk away. As well as shops, restaurants and delightful pattiseries all within a minutes walk. We arrived several hours before check-in, but it wasn't a problem and our room was ready. The room was spacious and very clean. Bathroom is a good size with a heated towel rail and the hot water is abundant. The toilet is separate. The 1st floor room overlooked the small street next door which had an upmarket restaurant just across from our window, but there was no excessive noise to bother us. King size bed was very comfortable. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Free wifi was great but occasionally flaky, but since we were at the back of the hotel, this may have been the problem. There is a PC in the lobby for your use if you need. Looking forward to going back to Paris and staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff, great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: BeezKneez333
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel it was perfect for our short 4 day stay. Great room, location and value for money. Would go back again. Plenty of local shops cafes restaurants. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff - GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: CZworld
Reviews.Content: Everything I was looking for in a hotel: A great location, reasonable (for Paris of course) rates, a nice clean room and friendly staff. Can walk to everything that matters and the metro is very close by as well. Special thanks to Jerome and the lovely lady who manages the hotel for making this my best stay in Paris. A bien tot mes amis!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Justin R
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on recent reviews on Trip Advisor and we were certainly not disappointed! The location is fantastic and the rooms are nice and clean. the staff are super friendly and very helpful and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location and staff"”
Reviews.Author: mike645
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights and enjoyed the great location of the hotel . We were able to walk to two metro stops as well as the Louvre and other major attractions. The staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and reservations. The only negatives were that the room was somewhat smaller than expected and we were never able to get the wi-fi in the room , only in the lobby. Other guests were having the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Helen_and_Yossi
Reviews.Content: We always say :"it was great, BUT...", this time there was no "but"... All was great: the location (center), the staff (ALL were helpful and very friendly with no hipocrisy), the room (quite, clean, cute and big enough for what we need). See you next stay...

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in bustling Paris”
Reviews.Author: Zoowabba
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights here and found the staff to be so helpful and friendly. The rooms were comfortable (small, but this is Paris!) and nicely decorated. The bathroom is small, but usable. The location is great - just 1 block from the Tuilieries metro stop and the garden. You can walk from here to many areas of Paris. There are wonderful pastry shops and restaurants nearby. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Small oasis In a Busy City”
Reviews.Author: Lincolncity60
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the heart of Paris. the Louvre is a ten min walk away, Place Vendome is just up the street. About a 15 min walk to the Musee d'orsay. This a very central hotel. A great tip if you are taking the Eurostar into Paris. You must have a taxi reserved because you can't get a taxi unless you call one for love nor money. The taxi lines are horrible. Oh and Gare du Nord is a seedy area. Keep a tight eye on your belongings at all times. from Gare du Nord a taxi is only about 25 euros with a tip etc. But do beware of gypsies while walking around Paris. We weren't dressed like tourists and we got approached 2 times with the brass "Gold" ring. Just walk away. Back to the hotel check-in was friendly , our room was 101 and it was larger than we expected it to be for such a small hotel. There is a closet with a safe when you first open the door to your room then you go through another small door to your bedroom. there's a desk, minifridge, and tv (the only english channels are Fashion TV, BBC and Stocks/finances) There is amazing air conditioning a lifesaver during the 40 degree heat wave. It was very quiet except for the Garbage pick-up in the early morning but that was it. The toilet is separate from the shower and sink which is a very good idea but that is French plumbing. The room was very clean and the decor was old world French but it was all brand new. For breakfast we just went to the little bakery 4 doors down from the hotel and It's amazing and cheap and they also sell fruit and salad, quiche, pastries, bread chocolate etc. but you must try the broiche swisse freshly baked in the morning. It tastes amazing but you more than burn it off while walking around all day. For a dining experience all it's own I highly recommend Guy Savoy which is amazing food and service and Chez Flottes on the rue cambon for an excellent roast chicken and order the giant bowl of vegetables. Laduree macarons are amazing. I love the Salted caramel so much. My favourite department store was Le Bon Marche because it was much quieter and not filled with tourists. Also don't attempt to go to Versailles in the summer because it is a nightmare!!! a fire trap waiting to happen!!! This hotel is great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Ages"”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryDad
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed May of 09 but either our review was not picked up or sent incorrectly. The staff could not have been more helpful, directions, recommendations for resturants getting around town, incredible! Clean, comfortable, we walked everywhere, so centeral to so many things. Would be our choice going back.

Reviews.Title: “Small and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: RiverrunWanaka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Relais St Honore in February with my sister in law and we found it perfect. I tossed up between this hotel and the Madelaine and in the end decided on St Honore for the location. The staff were very friendly and organised tours for us, taxis and offered restaurant advice. We were on the first floor, which I think was recently refurbished. Our room was spacious and quiet and we enjoyed the convenience of breakfast in our room on our first and last day there, but tried some of the local cafes other mornings. I highly recommend Le Cafe Marley, overlooking the Louvre Pyramid for breakfast or a coffee, just a short walk from the hotel. The style of the hotel is fresh, traditional comfort but with all modern conveniences. Good wifi in the room, excellent showers, and the bed was perfect! I slept for 9 hours on the first night there. My sister in law loves good food and dining and found the hotel well situated for local shops and restaurants. It is next door to Collete and not far from three metro stations. I like to walk, rather than rely on taxis and metro, and we were able to walk to most places, Tuileries, the Louvre, Place de la Concorde, Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tour. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Finallytimeoff
Reviews.Content: This was a second stay at The Relais, first time in 2006. Nothing has changed it is still amazing. We spent 10 days at The Relais Saint-Honore in July this year. The location is perfect, everything worth seeing in Paris is basically within walking distance and honestly, the purpose of visiting Paris is to walk the city. The metro is steps away from the hotel for those who want access. Staff is fluent in English and are exceptionally helpful and accomodating, familiar and able to make excellent recommendations for dining, touring, etc. Ask for Marie, she is wonderful! The rooms are typically European, small by American standards but who spends time in a room in Paris? If you want to watch street life, get a room overlooking the street. There is barely any street nosie but if you don't want to hear (barely audible) morning noise, ask for a room in the back. Louvre is right around the block, close to shopping, beautiful parks, what more can we say? Two restaurants within a few blocks we recommend are Juveniles and Willies Wine Bar. Dining at the Museum D'Orsay is a must! If you want to tour Versaille don't bother booking with a tour company. Go to the train @ Museum D'Orsay first thing in the a.m. it will take you right there.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: robin02907
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience staying at this small, charming hotel in Paris. We stayed 5 nights. It was nice that the staff members knew our names -- even when we checked in -- and they were attentive and helpful. The room was very clean, decent size for Paris, I think, and was quiet even though the windows faced the street. We were glad that it had an elevator (we stayed on the fourth floor) but it was so tiny we could only get 1 person and 1 suitcase in it at a time! The location was great, near the Louvre, easy walking to restaurants and patisseries, and a small market was located across the street. Would definitely like to have the opportunity to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: dbTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in September; it was my second stay in this hotel and I would definitely choose it again and recommend to friends. The location is fantastic, very close to the Louvre and Tuilieries, on a quiet street with nice shops and cafes. The room is cozy, charming and very clean. My only complaint with the room was the flat pillows; but not a big deal since there were 4 pillows for the double bed. Staff was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: GoProvidence
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and charming and has a great location for sightseeing. The rooms are small but were fine for our purposes. The beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet at night. The staff were very pleasant and tried hard to please, but we did have a few snafus with taxis. If you are looking for a place with upscale amenities, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a cheerful, comfortable, clean, safe, modest small hotel, you will be very happy. There are a number of restaurants within walking distance and a delicious breakfast cafe a few doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Paris Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BuonaNotteRoma
Reviews.Content: My wife and two daughters (ages 14 and 11) recently stayed at Le Relais St. Honore in Paris for five nights on a family vacation to the city. The hotel is comfortably small with a B&Bâ€™s warm feel and a quaintly decorated foyer â€“ replete with a single desk for the â€˜staffâ€™. We sought the hotel for both its great location in the central part of the city and for a change from the â€˜grandâ€™ hotels we chose for the other legs of our European vacation. Using the hotelâ€™s website we booked the large suite, which is the only room capable of holding four people (two on a bed and two on a pull-out sofa) and it was slightly tight moving about with our luggage in the room but we managed just fine. There was no problem booking the room online. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted by name; a truly charming way to begin the visit and were directed to our room via the Euro-tiny elevator. With two or three rooms per floor in the hotel, it was obvious that we'd found the type of hotel we were seking. The room was very clean and well maintained. We didnâ€™t interact with the staff very much except when passing through the lobby. They werenâ€™t overly friendly, but always polite and spoke enough English to communicate with our broken French. The hotel's location is probably its biggest asset. The shopping on St. Honore is excellent and the walking distance proximity to the Louvre, Jardin, Ile de Paris, Place de Concorde, Madeleine, The Opera etc. etc. made it perfect for us. There are fancier and grander hotels in Paris to be sure, but for a great change from that scene and for a more personal experience in a perfect location Relais St. Honore is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming typically Parisien hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roundhayparkers
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Tiny tall hotel with lovely "shopfront" and discreet receptionists. We were in Room 101 and it was a decent size with separate toilet and bathroom. The air-conditioning worked well, the minibar was covered in same fabric as curtains and bedding (never seen that before). Soft fluffy towels and plenty of hot water. Free wifi and were given three log ins for our three devices without any issue at all. Very comfy bed and pillows. Nobody bothered us even when we slept in - we could have had breakfast in the room but chose not to. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Superb location close to Tuileries metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice near the Louvre.”
Reviews.Author: NaomiNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais St. Honore for ten days in late April into early May, 2010. We appreciated nearly everything about this place. First, after flying overnight, we came in at ten thirty in the morning and were happy to be told that our room was ready. It was small, but had everything we needed, from good storage space to a nice bathroom with fluffy, abundant towels, a hair dryer and shampoo, shower gel and body lotion. The room was kept extremely clean. There is free wi-fi. Staff was always very helpful and went out of their way when we were unsure whether our flight was confirmed, spending a long time online for us and then, when they still couldn't find out, they spent time on the phone even though we didn;t ask them too until they found out that our flight was indeed confirmed. The location is excellent, two short blocks from the Louvre and very close to the Tuileries Metro stop. We chose not to buy the breakfast, at 13 euros per person, and found at least three shops nearby where we bought excellent breakfast foods. A great bakery is less than a block away, while a well-stocked grocery is directly across the street. There are two places within a block where one can take out coffee. As for noise, sometimes there were loud people in the street late at night. Most nights, no. My only complaint: I usually trust hotel recommendations on restaurants. This time, I was sorry I did. They referred us to a place around the corner which we went to because we had just flown in that day and were too tired to walk anywhere else. It was overpriced, as is most of the area; we ordered a steak and a lamb dish and both meats were grisly, and low quality. The restaurant has the word "Mariage' in its name. Go to this hotel but skip that restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with a Phenomenal Location”
Reviews.Author: sonja87
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, the person at the front desk knew who I was before I even introduced myself, and they let me get into the room early. It seems like they have very few rooms, as there aren't very many floors and from what I could tell only three rooms per floor. The service was generally pleasant, but there were some issues getting the internet to work. Because I was here for a business trip, it was important to be able to use the internet, but even after obtaining a wired connection, it was still extremely slow and many websites did not work. If fast internet is something you will absolutely need in a hotel, you may want to stay somewhere else. The room was very nice, clean, and the maid even folded my clothes and organized my toiletries while I was gone! There is a miniature fridge where you can place some items if you wish, and there is a nice little grocery across the street. The bed was comfortable, but as I am a light sleeper, I did hear some noise from the other rooms at night. Generally, though, the hotel is rather quiet. The area is safe enough that I felt comfortable walking around nearby alone at night. The hotel is very convenient to a metro station, the Louvre, and lots of shopping. I found the area to be the perfect location for my trip. At the front desk, they were very nice about allowing me to stay in the room past the normal check-out time. There are a lot of little shops close by the hotel where you can get a baguette sandwich or other items to eat on the run. I didn't have the concern about the cost of the hotel because I was there for business, but aside from that, I would definitely recommend this hotel as a cute boutique-style place that has a lot of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Comfortable, Central but expensive”
Reviews.Author: nvintage
Reviews.Content: Not sure its worth the price tag on this place, as we booked it as eurostar was paying for the hotel due to the train issues in December. Overall its a brilliant location situated just behind the Louvre, and in easy walking distance to shopping, supermarkets and dining options. The room was small but functional with a desk and lovely clean bathroom. Noise was minimal both internal and external and free internet was another positive. Really loved the area as there were some great Japanese restaurants to dine at great value prices. Overall Le Relais Saint-Honore had more romance than our last hotel but paying on my terms Im not sure I'd pay the increased euros for it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: barbev2
Reviews.Content: I'm sure that even if we hadn't been upgraded on arrival to a 5th floor suite, our experience of this charming little hotel would still have been absolutely perfect. The location is great, a short walk from the Tuileries, the Louvre, the Seine, and Tuileries Metro station. The hotel is elegantly decorated and furnished, avoiding the French kitsch of many similar small hotels, and our bedroom and bathroom were very comfortable and well-appointed. The atmosphere of the hotel is pleasant and welcoming, chiefly due to the helpful and obliging reception staff (all of whom were fluent English speakers). Breakfast - served only in the rooms - was more than adequate and good value. Free internet access in the reception area was a surprise bonus. Our only problem was that we had booked for just one night, and were reluctant to leave in the morning. Will definitely be staying at Le Relais Saint-Honore on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: SFcouple89
Reviews.Content: To provide some context, a little bit about us: - early 30's married couple - budget-minded but would opt to pay a little more for comfort and cleanliness, esp. if it could save some hassle - stayed for 6 nights Pro's - Charming looking hotel - Excellent, prime location (everything easily within walking distance: Louvre, subway, restaurants, Opera district) - Clean room with nice bathroom amenities (soap, shampoo, fresh towels, etc.) - Air conditioning, cable TV, digital safe, fridge, light switches next to bed - Friendly, English friendly, hassle-free service - Free Internet - 8 a Huit (convenience store) right across the street so you can easily stock up on water, wine, etc. Cons - Room may be just a tad small for some people - 200 euros a night starts to get expensive after a while (though, this is an expensive city) Overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: CassandraQuebec
Reviews.Content: The perfect small hotel. Quiet, clean, totally renovated, charming decor, delicious breakfast, bright room, everything worked, tv, cable, in room safety box, plenty of closet space, air conditioned, friendly staff, helpful concierge, relaxing lobby...easy access in and out, central to everything you want to see in Paris...cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Reserve this hotel with confidence - excellent staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: jodydancurt
Reviews.Content: I just spent 10 nights at the hotel, and could not have been more pleased with every person associated with the hotel, including the housekeeping team. The location is just right, and the Parisiens we encountered in every venue were just as cordial as they could be. I would love to visit again, and when I do, I will reserve my room at the Relais St.-Honore' !

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel; amazing location; would stay here again in a second!”
Reviews.Author: SarahandGlenn
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and enjoyed the novelty of being handed the keys to our suite without any paperwork to the moment we left, we experienced nothing but comfort and courtesy. After a long flight and thrilling cab ride, we arrived to a minimum of fuss. Our room (Ste. 502) was exactly as we expected. After booking on the strength of TripAdvisor reviews and their amazing location (a block and a bit to the Louvre!), we were happy to find everything perfectly as advertised. Our room was clean and surprisingly large for Paris. The front desk staff was courteous, helpful and fluent in English. My husband and I speak a little French and exchanged pleasantries in French, but resorted to English for anything more important as their English was much, much better than our French! On our departure, they happily held our luggage for the day so we could squeeze in Musee d'Orsay before moving hotels to Versailles. They were also kind enough to call a cab for us, but only after ensuring we were aware of the cost vs. other modes of transportation. (We still opted for the cab - 40 euros/25 mins.) A great, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenaged daughter and I just returned from a five night stay at this charming hotel. Four nights on the front end of our trip before heading to Reims and Tours and another night before leaving from CDG back to the U.S. They were gracious enough to store two of our bags with Paris souveniers and laundry so we wouldn't have to take them throughout the countryside. Conveniently located between two metro stops and a short walk from the Louvre and Tuileries, this small hotel is very well kept and has a friendly, English speaking staff. (Bonjour, Veronique and Sebastian!) We received excellent restaurant recommendations, transportation advice and an upgrade on the last night of our stay. The Jr. Suite with its full bed and bath also includes a loft with a single bed and half bathroom, but the spiral staircase up and the sloped ceilings will be hard on your head unless you are quite short. The convenience of that space for our daughter was well worth it, however. It's described on the website as a "mezzanine". The full suite is quite large with an excellent air conditioning system! Beds are comfortable, bathrooms are nicely equipped and the free WiFi is fast with a good connection. There is an "8 a Huit" quick grocery across the street and a patisserie and pharmacy several doors away. We thought the Continental breakfast available in your room was excellent. My family would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AliciaSanJose
Reviews.Content: The Relais Saint Honore is exactly what we wanted in a Paris Hotel. First the hotel is completely non-smoking - what a relief to escape the crowds of smokers on the streets of Paris! Second, the rooms are clean, comfortable and charming. For a Paris hotel the room size is reasonable and our rooms looked just like the ones on the website. Third the rooms have air conditioning. Fourth the hotel is in a fairly quiet location but still very close to the Louvre and Tulleries Metro stop. The neighbohood has many nice shops and place to eat. Fifth, the staff is friendly and helpful and they were happy to recommend places to eat, sights to see, even automatic laundries (although the hotel has a laundry service and room service). Our family of 4 had two double rooms for more than a week in April and we were very pleased. We often chose to walk home past metro stops in the evening so we could walk on a bridge over the Seine and through the end of the Tulleries garden near the Louvre. The pyramid was lit up and we could see parts of the gardens and the Eiffel tower in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Hotel, Great Location, Some Noise Issues”
Reviews.Author: LittleCupcakes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classified as a three-star by the French Ministry of Tourism. Overall, I enjoyed my stay, though it was not perfect. Good: Location, staff Not so good: small rooms, no other facilities, price, noise I paid an average of 179 Euro (about USD $240) per night in April 2009. I had three nights at 203 Euro, and three more (I think Saturday, Sunday, and Monday) at 155 Euro per night. I would not classify this hotel as a bargain by any means, but considering the location and Paris hotel rates, the tariff is certainly not too far out of line. Were I not addicted to TripAdvisor, I would likely have never considered this property. The Relais Ste Honore is a nice, tiny hotel in a nigh-perfect location. The staff (of which I never saw more than two at once, and most often one) was quite helpful, and were just as pleased to speak in English as to haltingly converse in my bad French. I think perhaps this is the best-located hotel in which I've ever stayed. Many major tourist sights are quite near. The Place Concorde, Tuileries Gardens, Louvre, Orangerie, and Musee D'Orsay are literally a few minutes walk, and places like Ile de La Cite and Place de L'Opera are not much further. The Metro (Tuileries stop, Line 1) is moments away as well. There are many restaurants, cafes, brasseries, and bars nearby. Paris tip: In a cafe or bar, order and pay for your drinks at the bar as table service will run quite a bit more for the same drinks. Watch out for bottled water prices; order "d'eau en carafe" for fine-tasting tap water. The hotel is small. The rooms are small, the lobby is small, the elevator is small, and the hallways are very small. As it happens, those areas comprise the entirety of the property. This hotel has no restaurant, no fitness center, no breakfast room, and (worst) no bar. I'm not complaining, as mostly I don't care about that stuff much (except the bar, of course); I just want to be clear and set the proper expectations. A room service breafast is available (I did not partake) for I think 13 Euros, and needs to be requested the night before. The hotel has complimentary wi-fi access in the lobby, but as others have noted, there is an open wi-fi network called "THOMSEN" that I was able to hook into and use at my leisure in room. Of course, that could change at any time. I saw a computer in the lobby, and I presume it's for guest use although I did not ask about it, nor see anyone ever using it. The room (I had 302-fourth floor) was small, but did not feel overly cramped (well, once I moved one of the chairs out of the way, anyway). The wardrobe was just large enough to hold my bags, but more than a couple of bags would present a problem. Though cute, the room is rather plain (probably better that way, considering the size), with the best feature being the painted wooden beams in the ceiling. The wardrobe was a little beaten up, but not too bad, and the room was clean. There was a strong perfume smell in the room when I checked in, but I aired it out and let the desk know, and did not have the problem again. The bathroom is actually of good size, with nice hot water and good water pressure. The separate water closet is also decently-sized. I wish the bars of soap had been larger, though. The minibar (it's kind of in the way, unfortunately) is decently-stocked, and priced in I thought a fair manner. But better, there is a small grocery across the street for stocking the minibar or having a snack or drink in the room. There is a TV, and it has a few English channels (CNN, SKY I think, but I turned it on only once). I was disturbed several times by noise. My room overlooked the side street (Rue Soutirade, I think). The restaurant's patrons congregated and conversed beneath my window, and there also was some loud music playing until quite late on a couple of evenings. Closing the windows helped, but not by much. But the windows couldn't help the noise of garbage pickup, or of the little grocery setting up shop for the day. After hearing this for a few days, I accomodated and was only woken up for a few minutes each day before nodding off again. These sounds should not present a problem for early risers. I also was disturbed by noise in the minuscule hallway (from housekeeping, the hallway telephone, and an odd elevator squeak) and water flowing through my neighbor's pipes. I didn't complain to the staff simply because I could not see what they could do for me, and overall, the disturbances tended to be short in duration, and even though I was disturbed by noise, it was not a stay-ruining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Charming, The Perfect Choice for a Special Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1704
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Relais Saint-Honore for 4 nights in a double room from Wednesday 15 to Sunday 19 April 2009. We chose the hotel for its location and excellent reviews and we were not disappointed. We found the hotel was very easy to get to. It is a 3 â€“ 5 minute easy walk from Tuileries Metro Station. The hotel itself is small and charming. It has about 15 rooms and a reception on the ground floor. The staff were always courteous and helpful. Breakfast was available and was served in ones bedroom but we choose to go out each morning and there were plenty of cafes and shops nearby. Our room was lovely and charming. It was very clean and beautifully furnished. It was very tastefully decorated with wooden beams on the ceiling and matching bedspread, headboard and curtains. The room was the usual small size for a European hotel but had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable. There was a wardrobe and shelves, desk, flat screened TV. There was an en suit bathroom with shower over bath and although small, very modern and contained everything we needed. Although the room faced the main street but we were not bothered by street noise. The hotel is very accessible for getting out and exploring Paris. The hotel is on Rue Saint Honore, on a street with cafes and designer shops so there are a range of places to eat nearby if one does not feel like going far after a dayâ€™s sightseeing. It also feels a very safe area to walk around. The Tuileries Gardens (delightful), the Louvre and Opera nearby. Itâ€™s a very special and delightful hotel and was perfect choice for us to stay during our wedding anniversary. We would recommend without hesitation and hope to return to if we are in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lynne55
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in April 2007. Terrific service from the moment we walked in the door. We arrived in the morning-they locked up our luggage and it was in our room when we arrived back at the hotel in the PM. We were on the 3rd floor at the front of the hotel. Great spot. Everything was spotless. Very quiet room, considering we were facing the main street. Great advice on what to see and how to get there. Would stay in this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nitravellerBelfast
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for a short break just before Christmas and chose this hotel on the basis of TripAdvisor reviews. It definitely lived up to expectations. The location is perfect, very central but quiet with little traffic noise. Our room was a good size and spotlessly clean. The staff could not have been more helpful. The hotel does not have any dining facilities and, although the room service breakfast was not cheap at 13 euro each, it was a nice leisurely way to start the day. The Rue St Honore is a lovely area for strolling and browsing, with lots of quirky little shops and cafes. The pre-Christmas buzz added to the atmosphere and the lights on the Champs Elysees and Galeries Lafayette are breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Stay”
Reviews.Author: jjgkec
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in a great location. Read about the posh new shopping area in Paris in the NYTimes? Well, this hotel is right in the middle of it. We went with my 73-year-old mother, who appreciated the lift in the hotel. Both rooms were smaller, but delightfully decorated and very clean. If you want a quiet hotel, I'd suggest not coming to Paris, but the street noise was minimal here. Very helpful hosts and staff. The breakfast was nice for my mom so she could stay in her room, but there is a little grocery across the street and a wonderful bakery just down the block,. The Tuilleries garden is just a couple blocks down, providing access to the Metro. The Louvre is walking distance. The hotel is part of the everyday Paris, so you do not feel like you are in the middle of a touristy part of town, even though the tourist sights are close. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: madjt
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on the recommendation of Tripadvisor members and wasn't disappointed. Excellent boutique hotel in a great location, walking distance to many sights and excellent shopping, (with an excellent Boulangerie close by). Staff were extremely helpful and spoke better English than my very poor French. My room was ground level and despite having concerns about noise from the adjacent lift, I heard very little throughout my 2 night stay. The room was comfortable and clean with all amenities and free Internet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone requiring a cosy and comfortable hotel in a highly sought after area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: vason
Reviews.Content: First time to Paris and I picked this hotel out of just knowing what area of Paris I wanted to stay in. I was pleasantly surprised by my stay here. The staff were very nice and helpful at all times, the rooms were very clean but a little on the small size....no surprise there actually. It's a very small hotel with only about 15 rooms total and overall it has an older feel to it. The location is great, a few blocks from 2 metro stations, walking distance to most sites, and 5 minutes tops to the Louvre. All the shopping you can think of within 10 minutes of walking which was nice. Many cafes and restaurants everywhere. Only negative I can think of is that breakfast wasn't included and would have been nice. A nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acgScotland
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay - 11th-14th October 2008 A small, charming hotel - five minutes walk from the Louvre. Housekeeping excellent. Very clean. The hotel doesn't have a dining room. If you want Breakfast you have to order it the night before and it is served in your room. Really not a drawback as there are plenty of places to eat close by! Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: djw62
Reviews.Content: My suitcase was lost by Air France, and all the staff at the hotel were extremely kind and helpful. They called Air France multiple times a day to help track it down, and assisted me in locating reasonable places to shop for emergency clothing. Every staff member that I met was fluent in English. Great location - right near the Louvre, and there was a nice fruit/convenience store across the street. The rooms were modern and very clean, and there was free wireless internet available (something that they do not advertise). Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: freddief99
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor and Alistair Sawdays website and was not disappointed. Its in a perfect location, 5 minutes walk from the Louvre, on a very nice street with some very nice (and expensive!) shops. The hotel itself is quite small with only a few rooms - very nicely decorated with plasma tv, minibar etc and very quiet (I was on the 3rd floor). Staff were very friendly and helpful and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, ambiance and service”
Reviews.Author: happytravelers1971
Reviews.Content: We spent part of our honeymoon there. Loved it! Found out about the Relais St Honore from friends who've lived in Paris for many years. The hotel is about a block away from the Louvre, a short walk from the Seine river, and the Musee D'Orsay, and yet it feels like it's tucked away in a nice little side street. Of course two dozen excellent restaurants are within a block or two, but across the street is a nice little market where you can get nice fruits and snacks and other necessities, and two doors down is a fantastic little french bakery. The room was tastefully decorated and cozy and felt like our own little apartment in Paris. The atmosphere is very romantic. We were on the second level and could hardly hear any noise from the street. The most memorable aspect of the hotel was their staff. They were all consistently warm and professional, very knowledgeable about their city and extremely helpful (a very useful thing, given that neither one of us speaks French). We will definitely stay there next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jkims2004
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 5 nights stay at the Relais Saint-Honore. I chose this place based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, and you folks did not disappoint. The room was very well done and cleaned impeccably, and the staffs were most helpful. All the staff spoke very good English, and very thorough and courteous whenever we asked for suggestions, directions, anything. To cap all off, I asked to make a reservation for us at Michelin-starred Taillevent at the last minute, and they made it happen. Also, the location is excellent. It's located walking distance away from Louvre, Vendome, Champs Elysees, etc. The street where the hotel is located, rue Saint-Honore, is also quite charming, with very nice small eateries, a majestic old church building I forget the name of, and Pyramide metro station just a block away. If you keep walking westward on this street, you will get to rue du Faubourg Saint-Honore, which is less glitzy but poshier version of Champs Elysees. C'Elysees has the flagship LV store, and FSH has the flagship Hermes.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service and strange policies”
Reviews.Author: couchpresser
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel, staff is VERY unfriendly. If you decide to depart 2 days earlier after a 1-week stay, they will still charge you also for the 2 nights. They have a 1 week cancellation policy, totally ridiculous. Staff cant stand english speaking guests at all IMHO. Also the room was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: dbourne16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Relais St. Honore for a month during an extended business trip and had no complaints during the entire stay. While this would not normally have been my first choice for a business trip, it turned out to be a great find due to the free high speed internet service, which is very rare in most European hotels. The staff were very warm and welcoming to me during my entire stay and knew my name from the time I first arrived. In addition to the comfortable stay, the location was excellent - within walking distance of many excellent restaurants, the Louvre, the Opera and just a block from a metro stop. I highly recommend Relais St. Honore, and it has become my preferred hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: lulusky26
Reviews.Content: October 26,2007 We just returned from the most beautiful city in the world! Relais St. Honore is a charming, country french hotel in the center of Paris. The hotel and rooms were spotless. The towels and linens were fresh and clean. The rooms were recently renovated and each room has its own style and class. The concierge were friendly and helpful. They all spoke English. They brought up our luggage and gave us directions to musuems, stores, etc. The hotel is located on the right bank. It is walking distance to the Louvre, the Gardens, The Concorde, Place Vendome, Musee D'Orsay, The Garnier Opera and the Metro. There are several cafes on the same street where you can eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We can't wait to return and stay at the Relais again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RedChile
Reviews.Content: The Le Relais Saint-Honore was a very cozy, comfortable hotel in a great location. The staff at the hotel was always friendly, helpful and polite, and made our first visit to Paris a very great experience. Our room had all the amenities and was laid out efficiently to make the best use of space. We had plenty of storage space for our luggage and belongings during our six- day stay at Le Relais. The Louvre was situated a few blocks away as were the Tuileries gardens and the Place de la Concorde. Groceries and cafes were steps away. We will definitely stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dtomlinson
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Relais Saint-Honore in August. The hotel is very clean and our room (a junior suite) was comfortable for 2 adults and 1 5-year-old. The reception staff offered good suggestions for restaurants and was very helpful with any questions we had. The location of this hotel is excellent! Walking distance to Louvre, Tuileries Garden and a metro stop (all within 5-10 minutes). Several good restaurants also in walking distance and public parking garage, too. Breakfast available in your room, but we opted for the nearby patisseries and a picnic breakfast in Tuileries garden!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mycaseispacked
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris in June '07 for our second wedding anniversary. It took a while to choose a hotel due to the occasion but this one is a great find. From the moment we arrived the staff were attentive, polite and spoke excellent english - despite our attempts to speak french with our A'Level and GSCE's from years ago at school! The room was nicely decorated, clean, tidy and well sized for Paris. The room had windows out onto the side street which was very quiet. The room layout is...different, with the toilet on one side of the room and the bathroom on the other? The reception staff noted when we left in the mroning and then instructed housekeeping to clean the room which was nice knowing that we would not be disturbed early on in the day. There is no resaturant/breakfast room but the hotel offers a room service breakfast. we chose not to have this and went out for breakfast at one of the many cafes and tabac's. A coffee, orange juice, croissant and toast is not bad in this part of the city for 9 euros? The hotel is in a great location in the heart of the 1er Arr, a stones throw from the Louvre, Jardin des Tuilleries etc.. and a short walk from the river and the 5/6 Arr on the south bank. The metro is nearby, although we walked most places. The lobby/reception area has a nice comfy sofa which the receptionist was more than happy to let us chill out on for half an hour on our day of departure - despite checking out earlier in the day - before the journey to the airport. The only minor issue is that there was a bit of noise (flowing water noise) from a down pipe in the wall cavity at one point during the night. A bit of a disturbance to the nights sleep, but nothing to make our Parisian experience a bad one!! Would recommend this hotel any time...

Reviews.Title: “We loved the French people and the hotel Relais St. Honore!”
Reviews.Author: Siti14
Reviews.Content: On July 5 and 6 we stayed in the cozy Relais St. Honore hotel. The day clerk was especially helpful to us through out our stay giving us a map to find the places we wanted to see and getting us a Taxi, ordering our breakfasts. The room we stayed in was conveniently laid out for a small space. Our breakfast was always on time and the hotel was quiet enough during the day for a nap when we had exhausted ourselves. As senior citizens, the location was close to so many major sight-seeing places that we could go back and forth easily. We were very gratified to experience the hospitality and courtesy of the French people all through out our stay in Paris and Provence.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in an Ideal Location!”
Reviews.Author: pilly5
Reviews.Content: My mom and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel. When considering hotels in Paris, we wavered between the Hotel Brighton and this one. But the location of the hotel on a quieter street with nearby shops ensured that Le Relais Saint-Honore won out. The location of the hotel is unbeatableâ€” literally steps away from a great bakery and grocery store and a short walk to two metro stations and the Tuileries Garden (from which we always started our day). The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful when making the reservation (via email only) and throughout our 7-day stay. The rooms, though small, were clean and nicely furnished. The beds were very comfy and the flat-screened TV gave us access to a few English (and other language) channels. We stayed facing a side street and we never heard outside noise unless we opened the windows. It took some time getting used to having the toilet in a room separate from the sink and shower. The lobby was small but inviting and had an internet ready computer, which was great for double-checking airport and attraction information. The elevator was small, but given that my mother and I packed lightly, maneuvering in it and in our hotel room was trouble-free. We ordered the breakfast on the first day, one of each type plus drinks (which cost additional). My mother really enjoyed breakfast in bed, particularly, given that the food was presented on pretty china. But, we opted to stock-up on breakfast and snack foods at the store across the street and the bakery two doors down in order to have extra cash to splurge on other meals and items. Overall, Le Relais Saint-Honore is a great hotel, and my mother and I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisSharon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite because we had our 2 daughters with us (ages 17 & 23). The suite was not huge, but comfortable enough for 4 adults. It was decorated very nice and was very clean. It was in a great location and the staff were extremely helpful. We were trying to locate our daughter who had been with a highschool group. We were having difficulities due to some wrong phone numbers and cell phones not working. The person at our daughter's hotel did not speak English, nor could she understand us. The hotel staff made all of the necessary phone calls and was able to find one of the leaders. We would go back. The price was very reasonable for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Le Relais Saint-Honore”
Reviews.Author: UT-EX
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with our rooms and service at this small boutique hotel. Having stayed in well known hotels in Paris with extremely cramped rooms I was looking for a different experience for our family of four and was extremely pleased with the space and quality of the Relais Saint-Honore's rooms. The staff was attentive and helpful, the hotel was quiet and the location of the hotel was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Captioner
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the Right Bank -- one block from the Rue de Rivoli and Jardin de Tuileries, two blocks from the Louvre, easy walking distance from D'Orsay, Place de la Concorde and the Champs Elysees, this is an ideal location. The room was very small and lacked storage, but all the amenities were fairly new and clean. Even though our room was on the Rue St. Honore, which is very busy (some rooms face a very narrow side street), it was always quiet. The staff was friendly but English skills were variable. Don't bother with the breakfast; there are dozens of brasseries and cafes within a short distance. We enjoyed our stay very much -- it's hard to beat Paris in May no matter where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: scribblewit
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here in early May and despite days of rain and clouds had a wonderful time -- this is Paris after all -- thanks in no small measure to our hotel. Small but lovely room with windows opening onto a quiet side street and, blessedly, double-glazed so the noise on Rue St. Honore was kept out. Pretty floral fabrics, nice prints on the wall, comfy bed, immaculately clean, good bathroom with the toilet in one room, the sink and bath across the bedroom in a separate room. Interesting. The location here is everything. I don't see how you could find anything more convenient for walking central Paris: one block from the Tuileries and the Louvre, easy jaunt to Left Bank, the Opera, Champs Elysees, and easy, easy access to two Metro stops. Great shops nearby -- bring lots of Euros or self-control. The staff is charming and speak great English, eager to help you. Highly recommend this place and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: levante
Reviews.Content: This must be my 4th stay in this charming hotel full of character and tastefully decorated. I have luckily stayed in one of their suites and also in the other standard rooms. They are all tastefully decorated and very comfortable. Linen and bedding is of very good quality and the rooms are obviously thoroughly checked to the finer details before you occupy them The staff are very accomodating and always ready to help and advise. Julienne brings in the breakfast with a delightful and cheery smile and Marie-Pierre at the reception is a source of information and always happy to help out. Finally, location is perfect as you are within walking distance of major interest spots and shopping. What more could one ask for ?

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seattlite75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for two weeks, from April 17 to April 30, 2007. During that time we had nothing but good service and good advice on things to see and do. The staff is very friendly and professional. The rooms are quiet and well maintained. The hotel is small, but that is part of its charm. It is located on the Rue St Honore in the middle of great restaurants and good shopping. We were able to walk all over Paris using the hotel as a base and the good suggestions from the various concierges. We recommend the hotel without reservation. It is an excellent value, a friendly place, and a calm place to stay in the midst of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lacking publicity but deserving of its ratings”
Reviews.Author: bathfoam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel Oct 2006. And its only now 2007 that I commit to giving it a review, which is half a year lapse. It shows the memorable experience the hotel has left me during my stay even after the long lapse. Staff speaks good English, giving you ready assistance, directions and recommendations to tour. Room is impeccably neat & clean whenever I return. Location is great to the various tourist attractions. The only flaw to its perfection was the broken seat on the toilet bowl, faulty air-con & cranky door that requires a lot of effort to close whenever I am in a hurry. Guess it's just one of those Murphy's Law. This is compensated by the helpful staff who served me even after I departed. They replied promptly to my email requests for hotel invoice which I lost. I, too, read the review before I book in. And it indeed lives true to its review. It's website is no deception as what you see on pictures is really what you get in your rooms. Beautiful beds and be welcomed by chocolates, a kind gesture from the hotel. ---

Reviews.Title: “HIghly Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mevankri
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I are staying here presently. The service is excellent, and the room itself is light bright and charming. I would highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely come back. The free internet service is a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: SidSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2006 and the weather was perfect for traveling. This was the third of three hotels we stayed at during this trip. The hotel was very charming and clean. My husband and I were comfortable with the size of this room, there was plenty of storage for our luggage. There was a good sized closet so we could unpack everything we had. There is a safe in the room if needed. They even supplied robes and slippers. The toilet was in one small room and the shower and sink were in another room. This was not an issue for us. I felt the shower/sink room was a good size. If you are a larger person then the room with the toilet might be a little tight for you. The bed was comfortable and daily cleaning service was very detailed oriented. The room as nicely decorated and the area was quiet at night. My favorite thing about this hotel was the location, it was minutes from the Louve, Tullerie Garden, & the Seine. We were also able to walk to Notre Dame and the MusÃ©e d'Orsay. This might be far for some people but we also walked to the Catacombs, which was worth the walk. Although when you exit the Catacombs it is a little confusing to where you ended up, so you will want to take a taxi back to the hotel. There is a small grocery store across from the hotel so you can stock up on snacks and drinks. There are shops all around this area and we felt safe walking around in the evening. There were very good restaurants in all directions. One thing that was annoying at times was you could hear people coming up & down the steps from our room. That could be a little noisy from time to time. We had room 301. Everyone at the front desk were wonderful and helpful people. They were so polite, informative and even helped with our luggage. I had booked my reservation directly with the hotel (via email), they were very prompt in their responses and made me feel comfortable that my reservation would be in order when I arrived. I would stay here again & would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: ilangelo
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, from chamber maids to manager, this hotel is an absolute gem. If you're interested in perfect service, this is the place to go. I was delighted and will definitely return.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Relais Saint-Honore
HotelInfo.Address: 308 Rue Saint-Honore, 75001 Paris, France
